oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pulchritudinous publicists, circa 1955 December 02
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two photographs, published in a 2 December 1955 Nashville Banner newspaper feature about the carol program and Yuletide project of the Fannie Battle Social Workers, titled "Fannie Battle Carolers." The captions are "Pulchritudinous Publicists," and "Party Patter." In the top photograph, left to right are: Mrs. Russell Dorris, radio; Mrs. Charles Andrews, store-ads; Mrs. James W. Blazer, Jr., clerical chairman; Mrs. Phillip Lee, posters and civic letters; and Mrs. Thomas Summers, television, as they leave a planning session to publicize the annual project. Next, below, is Mrs. Frank P. Provost, Jr., civic clubs chairman, and Mrs. R.M. Foote, public relations chairman, seen discussing the forthcoming Fannie Battle Christmas party. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 9.5 x 12.75 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dorris, Russell, Mrs.; Andrews, Charles, Mrs.; Blazer, James W., Mrs.; Lee, Phillip, Mrs.; Summers, Thomas, Mrs.; Provost, Frank P., Mrs.; Foote, R.M., Mrs.
Fannie Battle Day Home; Fannie Battle Social Workers
